sen.j: 漢詩文に秀で、1614年（慶長19年）4月、片桐且元に命じられ京都方広寺大仏殿の再建工事において梵鐘の銘文を起草した。
sen.e: In April 1614, Bunei-seikan, who excelled at making Chinese poems, was ordered by Katsumoto KATAGIRI to make a poem to be carved on the bell of Hoko-ji Temple (in Kyoto), whose Great Buddha Hall was to be reconstructed, but the wording of his poem caused trouble; Ieyasu TOKUGAWA claimed that his poem included an ill-omened expression for him, and demanded that the daibutu-kaigen-kuyo ceremony (a ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist statue by inserting the eyes) be cancelled (this is so-called "Hoko-ji Temple Bell Incident").
